channel.title: She's Legendary Vermin
channel.description: Recent content on She's Legendary Vermin

item.title: Grave Business
item.description: Foul Magicians Are Afoot! The sleepy town of Tinsform has recently fallen victim to a grave robber less interested in worldly possessions than they are in corpses. Everyone in town has come to the same conclusion: a heretofore unknown necromancer hell-bent on conquering the region must be to blame. The town constable has summoned a group of adventurers to do what the townsfolk cannot: kill the necromancer. Grave Business Grave Business was my first attempt at making any sort of roleplaying content.

item.title: And We Flew Together
item.description: A new girl moves in down the street from you. You feel connected and drawn to her in a way that is hard to explain. Before long, you share your secret; you can fly like superman. And We Flew Together This is a piece I wrote in a single day when I woke up from a very emotionally intense dream. At first I just wanted to capture the experience of the dream itself, but as I wrote it down I gained a clearer understanding of its meaning, and of myself.

item.title: Breath of the Wild is Good, Actually
item.description: That might be a really boring statement to you. You might agree completely with it. If so, this essay isn’t for you. On the other hand, if you didn’t like how weapons broke constantly, this essay is probably for you. If you felt like the story was too shallow to latch onto, this essay might be for you. If there was a moment in your play through where you got sick of dying all the time to basic enemies, this essay might be for you.

item.title: The Corporate Web, or How I Dropped off Facebook and Learned to Make Again
item.description: Today, there are dozens of platforms out there owned and operated by huge corporations that sort and serve content to us as consumers. Facebook and Twitter make it easy to see what friends, family and celebrities think, feel, and do at any hour of the day; Youtube and Netflix categorize and serve up video that is tailored to our watching habits; and Spotify does the same when it comes to music.

item.title: About Me
item.description: My name is Devin Helmgren. I’m a game designer, programmer, teacher and writer living in the Seattle area. I’ve worked most of my career on games of some form or another, be it for audiences of hundreds of thousands or for an audience of just myself. I’m always looking for ways to expand my sense of what it means for games to be games, and what it means for games to be art.

item.title: My First Post
item.description: This is my site! I haven’t got much to say rn, but that is A OK.
